p:
Model performance was compared using the corrected Akaike information criterion (AICc) [ 28] calculated by:
AICc = 2 k − 2 L +
2 k ( k + 1 )
n − k − 1
,
where
L = max ( l ( θ ) )
defines the maximal value of the log likelihood function, k the number of model parameters and n the number of data points the model is fitted to. Differences between models were evaluated by the
Δ AICc
with the difference always calculated compared to the best performing model with the lowest AICc-value within the corresponding situation.
